newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai leaning to France on light rail project.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai leaning to France on light rail project.

text.p: Shanghai is leaning towards France to provide government loans and equipment to build a light railway through the city, a senior Shanghai official said on Tuesday.
The 25-km (15.5-mile) elevated light rail line will follow an existing railway track from Wujiachang in the northeast of the city, past the railway station and down to the southwest.
"The French government has offered supplements to us," Huang Qifan, a city official told reporters at a briefing. "It is entirely possible we will cooperate with the French government."
"According to international practice, we would also use French equipment suppliers," he added.
Huang said the amount of foreign government loans to be provided to the project was still under negotiation.
An official at the French consulate in Shanghai declined to comment on what loan offers the French side had made to Shanghai city for the rail project.
